Detailed Description

Visual indicator of progress in some operation.

Displays a bar to the user representing how far the operation has progressed; the application can change the amount of progress (modifying the length of the bar) as it moves forward. There is also a secondary progress displayable on a progress bar which is useful for displaying intermediate progress, such as the buffer level during a streaming playback progress bar.

A progress bar can also be made indeterminate. In indeterminate mode, the progress bar shows a cyclic animation without an indication of progress. This mode is used by applications when the length of the task is unknown. The indeterminate progress bar can be either a spinning wheel or a horizontal bar.

The following example demonstrates how to use the ProgressBar

 gaia::ui::ProgressBar* mpProgressBar = new gaia::ui::ProgressBar(static_cast<Page*>(this));

 // Set the current progress to the specified value.
 mpProgressBar->setProgress(100);

Definition at line 51 of file ProgressBar.h.
